results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:6 Eps. 18-20
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. The first test on the new Eva turns into a disaster as the giant bio-human goes insane and runs amok. As Gendo unleashes the monstrous power of Unit 0:1’s auto-pilot, it becomes all too apparent that the Evas are more than mere machines. This disc, Collection 0:6, contains episodes 18-20.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:5. Eps. 15-17
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. In this instalment betrayals and revelations erupt across NERV as Kaji’s allegiance to an outside authority becomes apparent. Shinji’s faltering abilities become deadly when a new Angel attacks Unit 0:1. Meanwhile the search for the Fourth child begins. This disc, Collection 0:5, contains episodes 15-17.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:4. Eps 12-14
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. The war for the fate of mankind shifts to a new field of battle as a promotion for Misato sparks an introspective review of the events behind her early recruitment into NERV. Against a fresh wave of attacks, Shinji and Misato much face up to their conflicted feelings for their respective fathers, whilst trying to save the earth from destruction. This disc, Collection 0:4, contains episodes 12-14.

This disc, Collection 0:4, contains episodes 12-14.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:3. Eps. 09-11
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. As the Angels continue their assault, the forces of NERV are finding it difficult to combat the fresh waves of devastation. When an unborn Angel is found incubating inside an active volcano, a cataclysmic confrontation is imminent. This disc, Collection 0:3, contains episodes 9-11.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:2. Eps. 05-08
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. In this instalment, the young pilots must overcome their personal conflicts, in order to stave off the enemy. This disc, Collection 0:2, contains episodes 5-8.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:1. Eps. 01-04
results.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. As the human race cowers in subterranean cities, a deadly war is raged between survivors and the mysterious beings known as Angels. As the Angels and the Evangelions engage in deadly battle, the mystery of why the earth was attacked remains unsolved. This disc, Collection 0:1, contains episodes 1-4. Also available on VHS [309090].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo

As the Angels and the Evangelions engage in deadly battle, the mystery of why the earth was attacked remains unsolved. This disc, Collection 0:1, contains episodes 1-4. Also available on VHS [309090].

As the human race cowers in subterranean cities, a deadly war is raged between survivors and the mysterious beings known as Angels. As the Angels and the Evangelions engage in deadly battle, the mystery of why the earth was attacked remains unsolved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hideaki Anno, Yutaka Sugiyama, Noriko Kobayashi, Project EVA, Gainax and TV Tokyo
results.description: Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. As the human race cowers in subterranean cities, a deadly war is raged between survivors and the mysterious beings known as Angels. As the Angels and the Evangelions engage in deadly battle, the mystery of why the earth was attacked remains unsolved.

results.title: Nenette and Boni [Widescreen] [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Georges Benayoun, Dacia Films, La Sept Cinema, Canal+, Centre National de la Cinematographie and Claire Denis
results.brief_description: Set among Marseilles’ working class, Claire Denis’ “Nenette and Boni” is a coming-of-age film about a brother and sister who learn to make peace, forming a meaningful relationship out of dire circumstances. Nineteen year-old Boni finds release from his ennui with erotic writings - obsessive detailed accounts of his desires for a married woman. Boni is perturbed by the arrival of his little sister, Nenette, a teenager who is pregnant and in need of his support. Nenette and Boni have been estranged since the divorce of their parents, having lived separately for many years, and their reunion is fraught and even violent, filtered through the pain of their parents’ relationship. As the pregnancy continues Boni becomes increasingly engaged by the idea of the baby, whilst Nenette remains hostile to the idea of motherhood. This film contains some sublimely textural moments focusing on the patterns of the ordinary, cast as beautiful visions that contrast to the drab surrounds of the protagonists’ milieu, even if Denis does at times fail to provide expositional detail that explains the characters’ emotional journey. Winner of top honours at the 1996 Locarno Film Festival and atmospherically scored by the Tindersticks. Cast includes Gregoire Colin, Alice Houri, Valeria Bruni-Tedeschi, Vincent Gallo and Jacques Nollot. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Nelson Mandela
results.creator_credit: Richard Hughes, Mark Rowland, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
As the world’s most famous former prisoner to being his country’s leader, Mandela exemplifies a moral integrity that shines far beyond South Africa. In the revolution led by Mandela to transform a model of racial division and oppression into an open democracy, he demonstrated that he didn’t flinch from taking up arms, but his real qualities came to the fore after his time as an activist, during his 27 years in prison and in the eight years since his release, when he had to negotiate the challenge of turning a myth into a man. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Nelly and Mr Arnaud = Nelly & Monsieur Arnaud [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Alain Sarde, Les Films Alain Sarde, TF1 Films productions, Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinamatografica and Claude Sautet
results.brief_description: Nelly (Emmanuel Beart) is a woman unhappily married to Jerome (Charles Berling), an unemployed and unmotivated man whose attitude towards her borders on contempt. Nelly is struggling with their financial situation, juggling several odd jobs to make ends meet. One day she meets by chance at a restaurant, Mr Arnaud. He is an elderly, retired judge, reasonably well off and estranged from his wife and children. Arnaud, a complete stranger, offers to pay her debts, no strings attached, and Nelly reluctantly agrees. Intrigued by Nelly, Arnaud employs her to help him record his memoirs. Nelly is depicted as a somewhat aloof woman searching for a connection to those around her. Mr Arnaud is a man near the end of his life, financially secure but dwelling on past regrets, both personal and professional. The bond between them intensifies and as Nelly embarks on an affair with a dashing young publisher, Vincent (Jean-Hugues Anglade), Nelly and Arnoud’s relationship is threatened. Created from an original script, “Nelly and Mr Arnaud” is a gently observed tale about friendship and the vagaries of the heart. This was the last film directed by Claude Sautet before his death. In French with English subtitles.
